body_html:
Hi,

I am using rnn.row_rnn() with loop_fn which reads and writes a tensor_array of hidden states (e.g. I need more than one timestep memory) and I get the same error. Setting parallel_iterations =1 does not help me to move on.

In case of creating a python queue (or simply an array of cell_states) in the loop and passing it as a loop_state will still everything work fine in a graph while loop?

body:
Hi, 

I am using rnn.row_rnn() with loop_fn which reads and writes a tensor_array of hidden states (e.g. I need more than one timestep memory) and I get the same error. Setting parallel_iterations =1 does not help me to move on. 

In case of creating a python queue (or simply an array of cell_states) in the loop and passing it as a loop_state will still everything work fine in a graph while loop?
